website_summaries.verdict: A large screen with multi-touch and full HD compatibility, the crystal clear display and ergonomic design beat out other high-priced monitors in its class.
pros: Great for professional settings and home use, the size enables easy viewing of split screens or documents simultaneously
Users find the touch feature extremely responsive and with low drag, even in the corners
Can use it on the stand or wall mount
cons: Side buttons for power and screen controls are too small and sensitive for some
may inadvertently turn off monitor while adjusting it

website_summaries.verdict: The Acer T272HL is a striking 27-inch touch-screen monitor offering very accurate colors and responsive 10-point touch technology. It's a generally solid performer, but it loses some color fidelity when viewed from an angle, and it has a reflective coating.

customer_reviews.title: No more squinting!
customer_reviews.text: I was at the point where sometimes I needed my reading glasses to see my monitor -- but, on other days, I didn't. My aging eyes are just at the stage where getting them to focus properly is a constant struggle. So, along with a new pc, I treated myself to this monster monitor and am so very glad I did. I also purchased Ergotron LX Desk Mount LCD Arm, Tall Pole (45-295-026)to hold the monitor. This setup is great because, with the monitor up off of the desk, I have substantially more work area. The monitor provides a LARGE crisp display. Not using my glasses at my pc any longer. Heavenly!

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, Good Performance, Plug 'n Play with Windows 8.1 with One Usability Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Attractive design, good performance. No issues with using touch with Windows 8.1. It was Plug 'n Play. The only issue so far is what others have pointed out. The power button is on the lower right hand side of the display - right where you grab the display to tilt the display. Oh yes, titling the display takes nerves of steel because the amount of pressure you have to exert feels like you're going to break something. The speakers are functional; however, don't expect Bose quality from them.

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen function does not work on my Windows 10 PC
customer_reviews.text: I had multiple issues with this monitor. First, I was not able to get the monitor to work with HDMI on my Lenovo PC. I had to revert to VGA with an HDMI adapter (which of course I had to supply). Once I got the monitor to come on I discovered that the touchscreen function wouldn't work. I attempted to contact Acer customer support, but gave up when the only customer support numbers I could find were long distance to India. I sent this monitor back and will buy one from another company.
